hotspots.description: PDT rules severely limit trading flexibility for accounts under $25,000, restricting day trading to 3 trades per 5-day period
hotspots.mitigation: Use cash accounts, multiple brokers, or focus on swing trading strategies

hotspots.description: With $200-$1000 accounts, proper 2% risk management limits position sizes to $4-$20 per trade, making meaningful profits difficult
hotspots.mitigation: Focus on percentage-based growth strategies and consider scaling up capital before automation

hotspots.description: Even with zero-commission trading, regulatory fees, slippage, and other costs can significantly erode returns on small positions
hotspots.mitigation: Use commission-free platforms and focus on longer-term trades to reduce transaction frequency

hotspots.description: ULTY shows 70% NAV decay since inception despite 87% yield; AMDY has similar structural risks with return-of-capital distributions
hotspots.mitigation: Avoid high-yield option income ETFs for core holdings; treat as speculative positions only
